questions.text: Simplify: $$(\frac{7}{9} \text{ of } 405) \times 4 \div 5 = ?$$
Simplify: $$(32^2 - 18^2) \div 14 \times 8 = ?$$
Simplify: $$60\% \text{ of } \sqrt{?} = 80\% \text{ of } 450 - 240$$
Simplify: $$540 \div 18 + 25 \times 12 - 30\% \text{ of } 600 = ?$$
Simplify: $$18 \times 25 + 15\% \text{ of } 1200 - 450 = ?$$
Number Series: 50, 52, 49, 54, 47, ?
Number Series: 5, 11, 24, 51, 106, ?
Number Series: 12, 12, 18, 45, 180, ?
questions.solution:
Multipliers: x1, x1.5, x2.5, x4. 
Diff of multipliers: 0.5, 1.0, 1.5. Next diff 2.0. 
Next multiplier = 4 + 2 = 6. 
180 * 6 = 1080.

questions.text: The ratio of the monthly income of A and B is 5:4 and their expenditure is 3:2. If each saves Rs. 1600, find the monthly income of A.
questions.solution:
Income 5x, 4x. Exp 3y, 2y. 
Gap between ratios (5-3)=2 and (4-2)=2 is uniform. 
2 units = 1600. 1 unit = 800. 
A's Income = 5 * 800 = 4000.

questions.text: A invested Rs. 4000 in a business. After 4 months, B joined with Rs. 6000 and after 6 months C joined with Rs. 8000. If the total profit at the end of the year is Rs. 15600, find C's share.
questions.solution:
Investments * Time: 
A: 4000 * 12 
B: 6000 * 8 (Joined after 4 months) 
C: 8000 * 6 (Joined after 6 months) 
Ratio: 48000 : 48000 : 48000 = 1 : 1 : 1. 
C's share = 1/3 * 15600 = 5200.

questions.text: A vessel contains 60 liters of pure milk. 12 liters of milk is removed and replaced with water. This process is repeated one more time. Find the quantity of milk left in the final mixture.
questions.solution:
Formula: Final = Initial * (1 - replaced/total)^n 
Final = 60 * (1 - 12/60)^2 = 60 * (4/5)^2 
= 60 * 16/25 = 2.4 * 16 = 38.4 Liters.

questions.text: The difference between Compound Interest and Simple Interest on a certain sum for 2 years at 10% per annum is Rs. 45. Find the sum.
A is 20% more efficient than B. If A takes 10 days less than B to complete a work, in how many days can they complete the work together?
questions.solution:
Efficiency A:B = 120:100 = 6:5. 
Time Ratio A:B = 5:6. 
Difference 1 unit = 10 days. 
A takes 50 days, B takes 60 days. 
Together = (50*60)/(50+60) = 3000/110 = 300/11 days.

questions.text: By selling an article for Rs. 480, a person loses 20%. At what price should he sell it to make a profit of 20%?
The speed of a boat downstream is 150% of its speed upstream. If the speed of the stream is 3 km/hr, find the speed of the boat in still water.
questions.solution:
Ratio D : U = 150 : 100 = 3 : 2. 
Let D = 3x, U = 2x. 
Stream Speed = (D-U)/2 = x/2 = 3. So x = 6. 
Boat Speed = (D+U)/2 = 5x/2 = (5*6)/2 = 15 km/hr.

questions.text: The area of a square is 196 sq cm. A rectangle has a breadth equal to the side of the square and length equal to twice its breadth. Find the perimeter of the rectangle.
questions.solution:
Side of square = Sqrt(196) = 14. 
Rect Breadth (B) = 14. 
Length (L) = 2 * 14 = 28. 
Perimeter = 2(L+B) = 2(28+14) = 2(42) = 84 cm.

questions.text: Present age of a father is 3 times the age of his son. 5 years hence, the father's age will be 2.5 times the son's age. Find the father's present age.
A bag contains 4 Red balls and 5 Blue balls. If 2 balls are drawn at random, what is the probability that both are Blue?
questions.solution:
Total balls = 9. Select 2 = 9C2 = 36. 
Select 2 Blue = 5C2 = 10. 
Prob = 10/36 = 5/18.

questions.text: A train 150m long crosses a pole in 10 seconds. How much time will it take to cross a platform of length 225m?
questions.solution:
Speed = 150/10 = 15 m/s. 
Total Distance = Train + Platform = 150 + 225 = 375m. 
Time = 375 / 15 = 25 seconds.

questions.text: The average weight of 20 boys is 15 kg. If a new boy joins, the average weight increases by 0.5 kg. Find the weight of the new boy.
questions.solution:
New Total = 21 * 15.5. Old Total = 20 * 15. 
Shortcut: New Weight = Old Avg + (Increase * New Total Members) 
= 15 + (0.5 * 21) = 15 + 10.5 = 25.5 kg.

questions.text: Pipe A can fill a tank in 12 hours, B in 15 hours, and C can empty it in 20 hours. If all are opened together, how long will it take to fill the tank?
questions.solution:
LCM = 60 units. 
Eff: A=+5, B=+4, C=-3. 
Net Eff = 5+4-3 = 6 units/hr. 
Time = 60/6 = 10 hours.

questions.text: The price of sugar is increased by 20%. By what percent should a family reduce its consumption so that the expenditure remains the same?
Two trains of lengths 100m and 120m are traveling in opposite directions at 50 km/hr and 40 km/hr respectively. Find the time taken to cross each other.
questions.solution:
Rel Speed = 50+40 = 90 km/hr = 90 * 5/18 = 25 m/s. 
Total Dist = 100 + 120 = 220m. 
Time = 220 / 25 = 8.8 seconds.

questions.text:
DI Set 1 (Table): Study the missing data table carefully. 
Shop A: Total Items = 800, Sold% = 40%. 
Shop B: Total Items = ?, Sold% = 60% (Given: Unsold Items = 320). 
Shop C: Total Items = 600, Sold% = ? (Given: Sold Items = 450). 

Q31. Find the total number of sold items in Shop B.
questions.solution:
Shop B Unsold% = 100 - 60 = 40%. 
40% of Total = 320 -> Total = 800. 
Sold = 60% of 800 = 480.

questions.text: DI Set 1: Find the ratio of Unsold items of Shop A to Sold items of Shop C.
questions.solution:
Shop A Unsold = 60% of 800 = 480. 
Shop C Sold = 450. 
Ratio = 480 : 450 = 48 : 45 = 16 : 15.

questions.text: DI Set 1: What is the average number of Unsold items in Shop A and Shop B?
questions.solution:
Shop A Unsold = 480. 
Shop B Unsold = 320. 
Average = (480 + 320) / 2 = 800 / 2 = 400.

questions.text: DI Set 1: Total items in Shop B is approximately what percent more than Total items in Shop C?
DI Set 1: Find the sum of Sold items of Shop A and Unsold items of Shop C.

DI Set 2 (Caselet): In a school of 1600 students, the ratio of Boys to Girls is 5:3. 
20% of Boys and 25% of Girls play Cricket. 
40% of Boys and 30% of Girls play Football. 
The rest play no game. 

Q36. Find the total number of students playing Cricket.
questions.solution:
Boys = 5/8 * 1600 = 1000. Girls = 600. 
Cricket Boys = 20% of 1000 = 200. 
Cricket Girls = 25% of 600 = 150. 
Total Cricket = 200 + 150 = 350.

questions.text: DI Set 2: Find the ratio of Boys playing Football to Girls playing no game.
questions.solution:
Football Boys = 40% of 1000 = 400. 
Girls playing games = 25%(Cr) + 30%(Ft) = 55%. 
Girls no game = 45% of 600 = 270. 
Ratio = 400 : 270 = 40 : 27.

questions.text: DI Set 2: Number of Girls playing Football is what percent of Boys playing Cricket?
DI Set 2: Find the average number of students who play no game.
questions.solution:
Boys no game = 100% - (20+40)% = 40% of 1000 = 400. 
Girls no game = 270. 
Total no game = 670. 
Average = 670 / 2 = 335.

questions.text: DI Set 2: Find the difference between total Boys playing any game and total Girls playing any game.
